thread.title: Oakgrove Stud welcomes first Al Kazeem foal
thread.title_full: Oakgrove Stud welcomes first Al Kazeem foal

title: Oakgrove Stud welcomes first Al Kazeem foal
text:
Al Kazeem: son of Dubawi stands at Oakgrove Stud at a fee of £12,000 PICTURE: Getty Images Oakgrove Stud welcomes its first Al Kazeem foal By Martin Stevens 7:56PM 15 JAN 2017 
OAKGROVE STUD near Chepstow has welcomed the first homebred foal by its four-time Group 1 winner Al Kazeem. 
Stud owner John Deer sent Al Kazeem a number of mares in his first season at the Royal Studs in 2014, when the horse was found to be subfertile and returned to the track. None of Deer's mares got in foal. 
Back racing, Al Kazeem won the Winter Hill Stakes, Prix d'Harcourt and Tattersalls Gold Cup to add to the five Group victories - three at the highest level - he achieved before his initial retirement. 
The son of Dubawi returned to his birthplace of Oakgrove Stud to stand at a fee of £12,000 in a carefully managed role and Deer sent him many of his best mares. 
The first resultant foal - pictured below - is a filly out of Avessia , a daughter of Deer's classy sprinter Averti and a sister to his Prix de l'Abbaye hero Avonbridge, who also stands at Oakgrove Stud. 
Deer's son Philip said: "She is a cracking three-day-old filly. She is the first Al Kazeem born at Oakgrove, the first foal born there this year and the first Al Kazeem bred by Oakgrove. 
"The dam is Avessia, a full-sister to Avonbridge, so very much a product of the stud." 
Al Kazeem is standing the 2017 season at a fee of £12,000 again. The newborn Al Kazeem filly out of a sister to Avonbridge at Oakgrove PICTURE: Oakgrove Stud
